node.title: Additional energy term in TotalFreeEnergy
node.bodyText:
Hello team,
I need to calculate the total energy of the system for a phase separation in diblock copolymers. The energy function has an additional term compared to what is described here. I feel utilizing the additional_free_energy option in TotalFreeEnergy is the easiest way.
The additional term is of the form $$\int_\Omega G(x,y)(u(x)-m)dy$$. Here, both $$x$$ and $$y$$ are the position vectors not just coordinates. $$x$$ is the Quadrature point at which the integral has to be calculated to contribute to the free energy.
Now, how can this be written most efficiently?

Hello
So this integral is being computed over the whole volume?
And are you missing a dx in there? Or is the "x" the currentl location (e.g. this term is a field not a single value)
Guillaume

So it seems we need some sort of sweeping step to compute this integral over the entire mesh.
@dschwen @laagesen @jessecarterMOOSE
I don't think we have a way to do this currently, unless there is something similar from the Rigid Body Motion work that was done several years ago, can you comment on this @SudiptaBiswas?

node.title: ERROR : Could not find nodes!
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have consulted the Posting Guidelines.
 I have searched the Discussions Forum and MOOSE Framework Troubleshooting and have not found what I was looking for
 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)

Issue or question about MOOSE
Hi everyone, I've been having a lot of trouble with MOOSE recently. I'm a beginner and I am trying to get MOOSE to read a file with a mesh but I keep getting an error saying that the nodes can't be found. However, I know that the unv file has nodes and a mesh so I don't understand why this is happening. I don't think it's an issue from my input file because my colleague can't seem to find anything wrong with it. Has this ever happened to anyone? If so how have you fixed the issue? Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you.
(Optional) code in question / simulation log / errors
*** ERROR ***
ERROR: Could not find nodes!
Stack frames: 18
0: libMesh::print_trace(std::ostream&)
1: libMesh::MacroFunctions::report_error(char const*, int, char const*, char const*, std::ostream&)
2: libMesh::UNVIO::read_implementation(std::istream&)
3: libMesh::UNVIO::read(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
4: libMesh::NameBasedIO::read(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
5: libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::read(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, void*, bool, bool)
6: FileMeshGenerator::generate()
7: MeshGenerator::generateInternal()
8: MeshGeneratorSystem::executeMeshGenerators()
9: Action::timedAct()
10: ActionWarehouse::executeActionsWithAction(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
11: ActionWarehouse::executeAllActions()
12: MooseApp::runInputFile()
13: MooseApp::run()
14: ./navier_stokes-opt(+0x30ea) [0x55667674a0ea]
15: main
16: __libc_start_main
17: ./navier_stokes-opt(+0x338b) [0x55667674a38b]
[0] ../src/mesh/unv_io.C, line 218, compiled Jul 19 2024 at 13:32:04
Encountering Errors? Please include diagnostic output
No response

Hello
The .unv file must not be read properly. Or it is nor formatted as expected.
How did you generate it?
Can Paraview read it?

[Mesh]
    [mesh]
      type = FileMeshGenerator
      file = 'HYLIFE_II_2D_medium.unv'
    []
     [merge]
       type = RenameBlockGenerator
       input = mesh
       old_block = 'Solid_1 Solid_2'
       new_block = '0 0'
      []
      construct_side_list_from_node_list=true        

This is how I generated the mesh in moose, I created the mesh from salome though. I'm having a bit of trouble reading it in paraview because there are no local readers for a unv format.

.unv is for
I-deas Universal format
is that what salome is creating?
what is the list of options in salome?
all the ones we can read are there:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/FileMeshGenerator.html

node.title: Multiple components with 2 phase flow?
node.bodyText: What would be the best way to model a pipe being used to pump liquid CO2 into a porous rock with brine? We want simple fluid dynamics in the pipe, but it seems the THM module's components only has support for one phase flow at the moment.

Hello
There are some examples in the porous_flow module for this problem.
THM is mainly designed for nuclear engineering flow loops at this point.
EDIT: this is arguable. Let's say that it is designed for single phase compressible fluids.
Guillaume

Hello Guillaume
Which examples consider the fluid flow in the pipe as well as the rock?
Jonathan
@cpgr are there any?

node.title: Time to NodalValueSampler
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
So i am trying to output the temperature at certain nodes in my mesh file as below, for n timesteps. To get all the data in one file, i used contains_complete_history = true.  I want to plot the Temperature vs time for 4 or 5 radii (x^2+y^2), for a fixed z (= 0 8 16 24 32 40).
However, when i open the csv file, the same node id is not present 10 times, for instance the node id 2 is only present once. Is the node id updated after every iteration?
Any idea how i can obtain the time along with the other vpp values, so that it is easier to identify the state of the nodes at a certain timestep
[VectorPostprocessors]
   [./AllElementTemp]
     type = NodalValueSampler
     variable = 'T'
     sort_by = id
     contains_complete_history = true
     use_displaced_mesh = true
     boundary = 'bottom z8 z16 z24 z32 top'
   [../]
[]

Is the node id updated after every iteration?

This is not the case by default, but you are using displaced meshes so that could happen if repartitioning and consequently re-numbering happened in parallel.

 contains_complete_history = true


Using different files, one for each time step, is less messy than this option.
Especially sorting by id rather than than time, I don't know what the output will be ordered like
Okay thank you for the answer. I changed it to false and made a script file to sort through the multiple files.
@GiudGiud Is there a way to get time to be output to the VPPfile?

not that I can see.
the timestep is in the name of the csv
otherwise you can add time as an auxvariable
[AuxVariables/time]
[]
[AuxKernels/set_time]
  type = ParsedAux
  expression = 't'
use_xyzt = true
[]
Yeah I'm after time not timestep. The AuxVariable worked 👍

node.title: TimeRampFunction is not a registered object
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have consulted the Posting Guidelines.
 I have searched the Discussions Forum and MOOSE Framework Troubleshooting and have not found what I was looking for
 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)

Issue or question about MOOSE
I have successfully created and run a thermal hydraulics based script in the thermal hydraulics module of moose (projects/moose/modules/thermal_hydraulics/) to produce results etc. I would like to run it in my own application that I have created so that I can expand to use other modules. I made the application and enabled the modules I want in the makefile and then rebuilt the app. When I run the script it says 'A 'TimeRampFunction' is not a registered object'.
Any help would be greatly appreciated!
(I am working on the HPC sawtooth interactive desktop.)
(Optional) code in question / simulation log / errors
No response
Encountering Errors? Please include diagnostic output
No response

Hello
Save all your work then git clean -xfD both moose/ and your application then recompile
Guillaume
Solved. THX!

node.title: Phase field fracture (simple and cohesive zone model)
node.bodyText: Can anyone guide where will the easy tutorials be found for learning as a beginner? I have already gone through every phase field theory and examples available on moose platform. I am finding difficulty in writing my own personal input file with imported mesh. Are there any handbook or step by step guidelines available for writing moose code?

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Mesh/ talks about the mesh system.
Phase field fracture examples can be found in modules/combined/test/tests/phase_field_fracture.
There is an external app called RACCOON that specializes in phase field fracture. AT1, AT2, PFCZM, etc.
DG-like CZM examples are in modules/tensor_mechanics/test/tests/cohesive_zone_model
You really helped me a lot
Especially the third point
thank you

node.title: malloc() error while running EBSDMeshGenerator
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I am trying to run a grain growth simulation using EBSD file that I generated from DREAM3D. I am getting the following error
mpirun -np 4 pfubc-opt -i ebsd.i 


*** Warning, This code is deprecated and will be removed in future versions:
Please update your main.C to adapt new main function in MOOSE framework, see'test/src/main.C in MOOSE as an example of moose::main()'. 

malloc(): invalid size (unsorted)
malloc(): invalid size (unsorted)

===================================================================================
=   BAD TERMINATION OF ONE OF YOUR APPLICATION PROCESSES
=   PID 182467 RUNNING AT ashish-Inspiron-14-5430
=   EXIT CODE: 134
=   CLEANING UP REMAINING PROCESSES
=   YOU CAN IGNORE THE BELOW CLEANUP MESSAGES
===================================================================================
YOUR APPLICATION TERMINATED WITH THE EXIT STRING: Aborted (signal 6)
This typically refers to a problem with your application.
Please see the FAQ page for debugging suggestions


Following are the files for the reference.
output_data.txt
valgrind.txt
my input file is
[Mesh]

    type = EBSDMeshGenerator
    filename = output_data.txt

      polycrystal_ic_uo = ebsd

[]

  [PolycrystalVariables]
  []

[AuxVariables]
  [bnds]
  []

    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [unique_grains]
    order = CONSTANT

  #petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type -snes_type'
  #petsc_options_value = 'hypre    boomeramg      vinewtonrsls'

  steady_state_start_time = 0
  steady_state_tolerance = 1e-8
  l_abs_tol = 1.0e-3
  nl_abs_tol = 1.0e-3
  l_tol = 1.0e-3
  l_max_its = 5
  nl_max_its = 5
  nl_rel_tol = 1.0e-3
  start_time = 0.0
  #num_steps = 200
  end_time = 149.973
  dtmin = 1e-20
  #dt = 1

  [TimeStepper]
    type = SolutionTimeAdaptiveDT
    dt = 1
  []

  #[Adaptivity]
  #  initial_adaptivity = 2
  #  refine_fraction = 0.7
  #  coarsen_fraction = 0.1
  #  max_h_level = 2
  #[]
[]

[Outputs]
  file_base = 'poly_out/fp_0p0_no_ani'
  exodus = true
  checkpoint = truee website
  perf_graph = true
[]


can you tell me what is going on and why it is failing. when I use the example ebsd file (IN100_120x120.txt)on the moose website the simulation works perfectly fine.
Thank you

Hello
You are on the right track with using valgrind to find the bug, but you will want to use a debug version of the code.
So instead of make -j6, use METHOD=dbg make -j6 then use the newly created dbg executable

This is what I got with the debug executable.
valgrind _dbg.txt

hello
is this file in Moose? I can't find ComputeGBMisorientationAngle
 ==227349==    at 0x90F153C: ComputeGBMisorientationAngle::getMisorientationAngles() (ComputeGBMisorientationAngle.C:234)

No. I made that material to calculate the misorientation angle derived from ComputeGBMisorientationType. But the error is still there with this material. But input file runs fine with the example ebsd file.
Following is the valgrind output with ComputeGBMisorientationType.
valgrind_dbg_1.txt

I cannot reproduce this on my machine.
I am using the output_data.txt file and the ComputeGBMisorientationType (since ComputeGBMisorientationAngle is custom) and the error does not occur, even in debug mode.
I printed and we are not accessing out of bounds.
I will add an assert to that code and you can see if debug mode hits the assertion on your machine. This could be a clue
otherwise please print graid_id and grain_num in the loop where it crashes and see if it goes wrong

Hello Guillaume,
Sorry for not updating you on this. I think I figured it out what was the issue here. In the EBSD file (output_data.txt) generated by Dream3d, the grainID was indexed starting from 1 instead of 0. When I changed that, the simulations ran smoothly.
It was a very small change.
Thank you again for help.
Ashish
thanks for reporting back. I made a note of it and we'll catch it properly in the future

node.title: MOOSE build fail on INL HPC
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have consulted the Posting Guidelines.
 I have searched the Discussions Forum and MOOSE Framework Troubleshooting and have not found what I was looking for
 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)

Issue or question about MOOSE
I tempted to build MOOSE on INL HPC for one of my projects, and I strictly followed the procedure outlined here:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/inl_hpc_install_moose.html
Everything was fine until these commands were executed :
cd ~/cluster_name/projects/moose/test
make -j 6
The generated errors are screen captured here:

Please assist me further with this error. I have tried this via Sawtooth2 shell terminal, and launched it from INL HPC on demand via my employee credentials.
(Optional) code in question / simulation log / errors
No response
Encountering Errors? Please include diagnostic output
No response

This annotation is pretty important, and may be the cause for the failure.

Basically, if you ran make in ~/cluster_name/projects/moose using any other machine other than sawtooth (the one you are using now), the error you are receiving may occur. Which is why we instruct users to separated their projects directory, labeled by way of HPC clusters available:
ssh sawtooth1 (or 2)
cd ~/sawtooth/projects/moose
make

ssh lemhi1 (or 2)
cd ~/lemhi/projects/moose
make

# Bitterroot is broken at the moment, but the idea is the same
ssh bitterroot1 (or 2)
cd ~/bitterroot/projects/moose
make
and etc.
In order to fix this, you will need to clean out your current repository, and build anew (add any untracked files before doing so, or they will be lost. If you have made no changes to MOOSe, you can ignore this comment):
module purge
module load use.moose moose-dev
cd ~/cluster_name/projects/moose
git clean -xfd
git submodule foreach --recursive git clean -xfd
Once cleaned, you should be able to run make:
cd test
make -j 6

I forgot to mention:
It might also be necessary to rebuild PETSc, libMesh, and WASP, for the same reasons above.
I encountered the same issue as you. Did you manage to solve it?

Hi @jakson121,
I posted this question in the context of MOOSE compiled via INL's HPC. IF you compiled MOOSE under a similar context, please let me know and we ma y figure things out.
@jakson121 's originating issue: #28345

@ver2king, were you able to resolve this?
When I build on sawtooth2, using module load use.moose moose-dev, I am not running into an issue.

@milljm , I were able to solve this. Before using module load use.moose moose-dev, ensure to enter the correct cluster via ssh (for example: ssh sawtooth1). Also, ensure to re-build all petsc, libmesh and wasp. I tried on both sawtooth1 and sawtooth2 and have seen no problem.

node.title: HPC for Moose error！
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have consulted the Posting Guidelines.
 I have searched the Discussions Forum and MOOSE Framework Troubleshooting and have not found what I was looking for
 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)

Issue or question about MOOSE
I am setting up MOOSE using the HPC method from the official website. I have already completed the setup of libmesh, PETSc, and WASP, but I encountered an error while building MOOSE. Please help me！

(Optional) code in question / simulation log / errors
No response
Encountering Errors? Please include diagnostic output
No response

Hello
Is this a fresh install?
These errors are often seen when leftover compiled objects are present from a previous installation of the code
yes，I am installing MOOSE using the cluster method, but I encountered this issue during compilation. Do you know how to solve it?

Can you provide the results of a diagnostic?
cd ~/projects/moose/scripts
./diagnostics.sh

##################################################################################################
Influential Environment Variables
CONDA_CHANNEL=https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
CURL_CA_BUNDLE=
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib:/usr/local/lib:
MOOSE_JOBS=6
PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games:/usr/lib/wsl/lib:/mnt/c/Program Files/Common Files/Oracle/Java/javapath:/mnt/d/Software/bin/:/mnt/c/Windows/system32:/mnt/c/Windows:/mnt/c/Windows/System32/Wbem:/mnt/c/Windows/System32/WindowsPowerShell/v1.0/:/mnt/c/Windows/System32/OpenSSH/:/mnt/c/Program Files (x86)/NVIDIA Corporation/PhysX/Common:/mnt/c/Program Files/NVIDIA Corporation/NVIDIA NvDLISR:/mnt/d/Software new/MATLAB/runtime/win64:/mnt/d/Software new/MATLAB/bin:/mnt/d/Software new/Git/cmd:/mnt/c/Program Files/CMake/bin:/mnt/c/Users/AppData/Local/Microsoft/WindowsApps:/mnt/d/Software new/Microsoft VS Code/bin:/mnt/d/Software new/mingw-19.0/MinGW/bin:/snap/bin
PETSC_ARCH=test
PETSC_DIR=/home/junjie/software/petsc-3.21.3
REQUESTS_CA_BUNDLE=
SSL_CERT_FILE=
##################################################################################################
Compiler(s) (CC CXX FC F77 F90):
CC              not set
CXX             not set
FC              not set
F77             not set
F90             not set
FAIL: One or more compiler environment variables not set
##################################################################################################
Python Sanity Checks
Verify /usr/bin/env python3 --version (reporting as: Python 3.10.12),
matches versions for: which python3 && which python
WARNING: python does not exist
This does not mean there will be a failure, but some shebangs in some python
files may still be relying on calling: /usr/bin/env python (Python 2.x era)
OK
##################################################################################################
Python Modules (TestHarness, run-ability)
OK

This feels like you are running in a WSL session. Which is fine, but usually folks install our Conda packages when doing so. It is not a hard requirement of course, one could install everything from scratch. And if you have, what seems to be missing here is setting the necessary compiler environment variables.
I am not sure what to have you set those to, but we can see what happens:
export CC=mpicc CXX=mpicxx FC=mpifort F90=mpif90 F77=mpif77
# and then run diags again, see what it detects:
./diagnostics.sh
